      • roundDownByLargestPower

        public static float roundDownByLargestPower(float f)
        Round number down to in the largest power. For example, roundDownByLargestPower(3.1) returns 3.0 roundDownByLargestPower(-3.1) returns -4.0 roundDownByLargestPower(31.1) returns 30.0
        Parameters:
        f -
        Returns:

      • roundUpByLargestPower

        public static float roundUpByLargestPower(float f)
        Round number up to the next digit in the largest power. MiscMath.roundUpByLargestPower(31.1f) == 40.0f; MiscMath.roundUpByLargestPower(0.11f) == 1.0f; MiscMath.roundUpByLargestPower(-0.011f) == -0.02f; MiscMath.roundUpByLargestPower(310.1f) == 400.0f; MiscMath.roundUpByLargestPower(-3.1) == -4.0f; MiscMath.roundUpByLargestPower(3.1) == 4.0f;
        Parameters:
        f -
        Returns:

      • taylor

        protected static double taylor(double number,
                               int n)
        use the taylor series to approximate the natural log of a number. Note that internally, the variable x which is number - 1. ln(1 + x) is computed, so number = 1 + x and therefore x = number - 1; ln(1+x) = x - (x^2)/2 + (x^3)/3 - ...
        Parameters:
        number -
        n -
        Returns:

        public static double[] solveCubicRoots(double a,

        solve for the roots of equation a0 * x^3 + a1 * x^2 + a2 * x + a4 = 0; most of the method is adapted from http://www.csse.uwa.edu.au/~pk/research/matlabfns/Misc/cubicroots.m Copyright (c) 2008 Peter Kovesi School of Computer Science & Software Engineering The University of Western Australia pk at csse uwa edu au http://www.csse.uwa.edu.au/ Permission is hereby granted, free of charge, to any person obtaining a copy of this software and associated documentation files (the "Software"), to deal in the Software without restriction, subject to the following conditions: The above copyright notice and this permission notice shall be included in all copies or substantial portions of the Software. The Software is provided "as is", without warranty of any kind. Nov 2008
        Parameters:

        d -
        Returns:

      • realcuberoot

        public static double realcuberoot(double x)

      • chooseRandomly

        public static void chooseRandomly(java.security.SecureRandom sr,
                                  int[] selected,
                                  int nMax)
        choose selected.length unique random numbers between 0 and nMax and populate the array 'selected' with them. Note that the number of ways to make a subset of 7 distinct numbers out of nMax numbers is nMax!/(nMax-7)! So the probability of selecting the same 7 randomly from nMax is very low when nMax is much larger than selected.length, so this method does not check that the same 7 were not drawn before, but the invoker should for small nMax.
        Parameters:
        sr - class to generate semi random numbers
        selected - the output array to populate with unique random numbers valued 0 to nMax, exclusive.
        nMax - the upper limit from which to choose numbers from for 'selected', where the possible numbers are 0 through nMax-1.

      • findStrongPeakIndexes

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> findStrongPeakIndexes(HistogramHolder h,
                                                                      float frac)
        for the given histogram, returns the indexes of the primary peak and any peaks which are larger than frac*maxPeak above their neighboring values.
        Parameters:
        h -
        frac - the fraction of the y value of the maximum peak that is used as a critical limit that any other peaks must have in excess of their neighboring points. For example, 0.1.
        Returns:

      • calculatePolarTheta

        public static double calculatePolarTheta(float x,
                                         float y)
        calculate the angle of theta with respect to an origin of (0, 0) for the point (x, y). The angles are 
            90(=pi/2)
            |
            |
   180 ----------- 0
   (=pi)    |
            | 
          270(=3pi/2)
        Parameters:
        x -
        y -
        Returns:
        degrees in radians

        public static float[] writeDegreeIntervals(float rotStart,
                                           float rotStop,
                                           float rotDelta)
        write an array of the rotation angles that start with rotStart and increment by rotDelta until rotStop, inclusive.
        Parameters:
        rotStart - start of rotation angles in units of degrees
        rotStop - stop of rotation angles in units of degrees
        rotDelta - interval between rotation angles in units of degrees
        Returns:

      • writeToBigEndianBytes

        public static byte[] writeToBigEndianBytes(long value)
        write value to a byte array in big endian, that is LSB in highest order bit (MSB is in lowest memory address). these are signed values stored as twos complement and can be input to BigInteger's constructor.
        Parameters:
        value -
        Returns:

      • sumSquaredError

        public static float sumSquaredError(int[] a,
                                    int sentinel,
                                    int centralIdx)
        Determine the sum squared error within this array using auto-correlation and the assumption that the value at the middle index is the value from the original central pixel. Values the same as the sentinel are ignored and not included in the calculation.
        Returns:

        public static float sumSquaredError(float[] a,
                                    float sentinel,
                                    int centralPixIdx)
        Determine the sum squared error within this array using auto-correlation and a self reference value of the item at centralPixIdx in a. Any item in a having value sentinel is ignored and not included in the calculation.
        Returns:

      • lexicographicallyOrderPointsBySort

        public static java.util.LinkedHashSet<PairInt> lexicographicallyOrderPointsBySort(java.util.Set<PairInt> points)
             order points such that:
        q ≺ p : (i_q < i_p) ∨ ((i_q == i_p) ∧(j_q < j_p))

          (-1, 1)
          (-1, 0)   p=(0,  0)
          (-1,-1)     (0, -1)
        runtime complexity is 2*O(N_points) + O(N_points * lg2(O(N_points)))
        Parameters:
        points -
        Returns:

      • lexicographicallyOrderPointsByScan

        public static java.util.LinkedHashSet<PairInt> lexicographicallyOrderPointsByScan(java.util.Set<PairInt> points,
                                                                                  int w,
                                                                                  int h)
             order points such that:
        q ≺ p : (i_q < i_p) ∨ ((i_q == i_p) ∧(j_q < j_p))

          (-1, 1)
          (-1, 0)   p=(0,  0)
          (-1,-1)     (0, -1)
        runtime complexity is O(w*h)
        Parameters:
        points -
        w -
        h -
        Returns:
